summary: The jeep flipped going down an accessway and bent the entire roll bar.

PARKING BREAK SELF RELEASES. ACCORDING TO CHRYSLER THE RECALL WAS DONE MORE THAN 10 YEARS AGO AND IS THEREFORE NO LONGER COVERED. HOW CAN CHRYSLER NOT COVER THIS DANGEROUS PROBLEM. THE VEHICLE WILL UNEXPECTEDLY BEGIN ROLLING DOWN A SLOPE WITH NO WARNING. THE BREAK WILL HOLD FOR A FEW MINUTES OR EVEN LONGER AND THEN RELEASE.. IF THIS REPLACEMENT PART IS OF  THIS FAULTY A DESIGN WHY CAN IT NOT BE NOT BE REPLACED  WITH A MORE DEPENDABLE ONE. IS THERE A REPLACEMENT "KIT" FOR THE RECALL?  FURTHERMORE I WAS UNAWARE OF THE RECALL FOR THE FUEL PUMP/SENSOR GASKET AT TOP OF FUEL TANK AND THE CATALYTIC CONVERTER RECALL. I REPLACED THAT GASKET TWICE WITHOUT THE DEALER ADVISING ME OF THE RECALL.  AS I PREPARED MY BOAT FOR LAUNCHING THE BREAK RELEASED AND BEGAN TO ROLL BACKWARDS INTO THE LAKE, NEARLY RUNNING ME OVER. A NARROW ESCAPE.

1994 JEEP WRANGLER.  ATTORNEY REPRESENTING CONSUMER WRITES IN REGARDS TO VEHICLE FUEL TANK LOCATION THAT CAUSED A FAMILY MEMBER DEATH OF THE CLIENTS, HE IS REPRESENTING.  *SMD  THE DECEDENT WAS A PASSENGER IN THE VEHICLE. THE DRIVER LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE, JUMPED A CURBED, HIT A POLE, THEN A TREE AND BURST INTO FLAMES. THE DECEDENT DID NOT DIE FROM THE IMPACT, RATHER HE DIED OF THERMAL INJURIES CAUSED BY THE VEHICLE BURSTING INTO FLAMES...UPDATED 02/13/17 *BF    *TR

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 JEEP WRANGLER. THE CONTACT STATED THE SMELL OF FUEL EMITTED INSIDE OF THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO  A LOCAL REPAIR SHOP TWICE. THE LOCAL REPAIR SHOP MECHANIC CONFIRMED THAT THE GAS CAP FUEL SENDING UNIT AND CRACKED FUEL TANK NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS CONTACTED AND CONFIRMED THE THAT THE VIN FAILED TO QUALIFY FOR REPAIRS UNDER NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER: 94V106000(FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE:DELIVERY:FUEL PUMP) THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGES WERE 144,500.

I PARKED MY 1994 JEEP WRANGLER OUTSIDE MY WORKPLACE AT 6AM THE MORNING OF 4/4/12... AT 11AM I FINISHED FOR THE DAY, LEFT MY JEEP WHERE IT WAS, AND WENT FOR A RUN AROUND WHERE I WORK. AT 11:27AM MY OFFICE MANAGER CALLED MY CELLPHONE AND BEGGED ME TO COME BACK RIGHT AWAY "YOUR JEEP IS ON FIRE!!! OH MY GOD, IT'S GONE!!! NOW THE WOODS ARE ON FIRE!!!". I RAN BACK TO FIND 3 FIRE TRUCKS, MY JEEP NOTHING BUT A CHARRED SHELL STILL ON FIRE. I SPOKE WITH MY OFFICE MANAGER, SHE HEARD AN ALARM (MY HORN HAD I GUESS MELTED AND WENT OFF), WHEN SHE RAN OUTSIDE SHE SAW SMOKE BILLOWING FROM UNDER THE HOOD AND FIRE DRIPPING FROM UNDER THE FRONT (MELTING PLASTIC OF MY DASHBOARD). THE JEEP WAS DRIVING ITSELF UPHILL IN REVERSE! SHE RAN TO IT, TRYING TO STOP IT AND ATTEMPTING TO SAVE MY BELONGINGS FROM INSIDE OF IT (SHE COULD NOT). SHE SAID THERE WAS FIRE SHOOTING FROM UNDER MY DASHBOARD. IT DROVE ITSELF ALL THE WAY ACROSS THE PARKING LOT WHERE IT EVENTUALLY STOPPED ON A TREE. IT WAS COMPLETELY ENGULFED IN FLAMES, AND THEN EXPLODED. (I HEARD THE EXPLOSION AS I WAS RUNNING THROUGH THE WOODS TRYING TO GET BACK). MY JEEP IS GONE NOW... NOTHING SALVAGEABLE. I NEVER HAD ANY ELECTRICAL PROBLEMS WITH IT IN THE PAST... BUT AFTER SOME INTERNET SEARCHING I'VE FOUND THAT JEEPS ARE NOTORIOUS FOR GOING UP IN FLAMES.   *TR

EVERY TIME I FILL UP MY 94 YJ, GAS SPILLS OUT THE BACK OF IT. THE PUMP KICKS OFF BUT AS IT KICKS OFF IT SPILLS AND I HAVE TO CLEAN THE GAS RUNNING DOWN THE BACK OF THE JEEP. IT SEEMS TO ME THERE'S SOMETHING WRONG WITH THE BACK PRESSURE THAT KICKS OFF THE PUMP. I'M GUESSING THE FUEL COMPLETELY FILLS UP THE TUBE AND ONLY WHEN THE GAS HITS THE NOZZLE DOES IT SHUT OFF. IT IS VERY DIFFICULT TO FILL MY TANK UP AND IS ALSO VERY UNSAFE TO DO SO, AS GAS SPILLING OUT THE BACK IS A FIRE HAZARD. IT SEEMS I'M NOT THE ONLY JEEP OWNER DEALING WITH THIS PROBLEM. (HTTP://WWW.JEEPFORUM.COM/FORUM/F176/HAVE-FUEL-SPILL-PROBLEMS-LIKE-MANY-US-SUBMIT-COMPLAINT-FORCE-RECALL-974337/)  SO HERE I AM FILING MY COMPLAINT, I HOPE SOMETHING WILL BE DONE. BECAUSE I'M TIRED OF BEING SOAKED IN GAS EVERY TIME I TRY TO FILL MY TANK.  *TR
FAILURE OF FUEL TANK SEAL CREATING FIRE HAZARD. INTERNET SEARCH REVEALS THIS A COMMON FAILURE, EITHER AT FILLER NEXT OR FUEL PUMP SEAL.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1994 JEEP WRANGLER.  DURING AN EMISSIONS TEST, THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT HER GAS TANK WAS LEAKING.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO A SERVICE STATION AND SEVERAL DIAGNOSTICS WERE PERFORMED TO LOCATE THE CAUSE OF THE LEAK.  THE VEHICLE HAS NOT BEEN DIAGNOSED BY THE DEALER.  THE CURRENT AND FAILURE MILEAGES WERE 91,656.
GAS AND FUMES THAT HAVE BEEN FOUND TO BE COMING FROM TOP OF PLASTIC FUEL TANK. THE ODOR HAS BEEN PRESENT FOR A NUMBER OF YEARS.  *TR
STEERING WHEEL LOCKED WHILE THE AUTO WAS IN MOTION, STEERING WHEEL NO LONGER LOCKS WHEN PARKED.  *TR
NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID NUMBER: 94V106000   FUEL VAPOR LEAKAGE VIA PLASTIC GAS TANK.  DEALER/MANUFACTURER WILL NOT PAY FOR REPAIR.  *JB

DESPITE MY JEEP WRANGLER HAVING BEEN RECALLED DUE TO FAULTY PARKING BRAKES RECALL # 02V- 041000, THIS PROBLEM PERSISTS.  I HAVE TAKEN MY CAR TO THE DEALERSHIP NUMEROUS TIMES WHERE THEY TIGHTEN THE PARKING BRAKE AND EACH TIME IT EVENTUALLY SLIPS AGAIN.  I NO PARK MY CAR IN GEAR WHICH KEEPS IT STATIONARY BUT EVERY TIME I AM NOT PARKED IN GEAR MY CAR ROLLS AWAY.  MANY TIMES THE BRAKE IS ON AND SUDDENLY COME OFF BUT PLENTY OF OTHER TIMES THE CAR MOVES EVEN WHEN THE BRAKE IS ON.  I HAVE TAKEN IT TO THE DEALER SEVERAL TIMES AND THERE'S NOTHING THEY CAN DO.  THE ONLY REASON THIS CAR EVEN PASSES INSPECTION IS THAT THE BRAKE IS TIGHTENED AND IMMEDIATELY TESTED.  WITHIN A FEW DAYS, THE BRAKE IS BACK TO IT'S USUAL NON HOLDING SELF.  *NM

1994 JEEP WRANGLER PURCHASED 24 APR 94. FUEL SHOOTS OUT OF FUEL TANK AT FUEL LINE CONNECTION WHEN ENGINE IS TURNED ON. FIRST TIME OCCURRED ON 30 JULY 97, REPAIRED BY JEEP DEALERSHIP. SECOND OCCURRENCE HAPPENED  FEBRUARY 3 2004 REPAIRED BY LOCAL MECHANIC. THIRD OCCURRENCE, 15 NOV 05, TAKING JEEP INTO CHRYSLER DEALERSHIP FOR REPAIR ON 25 MAY 06. CONTACTED CHRYSLER CORPORATION SEVERAL TIMES TO FIX DEFECT, EACH TIME EXPLAINED CHRYSLER WILL NOT PAY FOR FIX AS VEHICLE IS OUT OF WARRANTY AND PART IS "MAN MADE." MOST RECENT CONVERSATION WITH CHRYSLER IN APRIL '06 WAS INFORMED THAT 2ND TIME COULD HAVE BEEN FIXED DUE TO DRIVE TRAIN WARRANTY BUT THEY WOULD NOT PAY FOR REPAIR AS IT WAS LAST FIXED BY NON-DEALERSHIP MECHANIC. ALSO INFORMED THAT THIS VEHICLE DOES NOT FALL UNDER 3 JAN 95 RECALL NOTICE FOR UNKNOWN REASON.  *JB

NO EVENT TOOK PLACE THAT I AM AWARE OF.  I WAS NOTIFIED IN THE MIDDLE OF SEPTEMBER 2005 DURING ROUTINE MAINTENANCE THAT THE VEHICLES STEERING GEAR BOX WAS LEAKING WHICH REQUIRES REPLACEMENT IN ADDITION TO THE STEERING SHAFT ASSEMBLY.  A SCHEDULING DATE FOR REPAIR IS ON OCTOBER 20, 2005 WITH A SUBSTANTIAL COST. *JB

1994 JEEP WRANGLER HAD FAULTY PARKING BRAKE EQUIPMENT WHICH RESULTED IN THE JEEP ROLLING INTO A WALL AFTER PARKING BRAKE WAS ENGAGED.*MR  THE CONSUMER HAD THE ACCIDENT AND PAID FOR THE RECALL REPAIRS PRIOR TO RECEIVING THE RECALL NOTICE AND HE IS NOW REQUESTING REIMBURSEMENT. (RECALL #02V041000)*JB

DRIVER'S SEAT BELT FAILED TO CLICK  ON ITS OWN. CONSUMER WAS ABLE TO DRIVE THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER, AND MECHANIC INFORMED CONSUMER THAT THE SEAT BELTS DID NOT HAVE  A LIFE TIME WARRANTY.  CONSUMER HAD TO RENDER PAYMENT FOR THE SEAT BELTS.  *AK

FRONT SEAT BELT RETRACTORS CONTINUALLY FAIL TO RETRACT SEATBELT FULLY, USUALLY LEAVING 8-10 INCHES OF BELT ON THE FLOOR AND SOMETIMES HANGING OUTSIDE THE DOOR FRAME. THIS HAS BEEN A RE-OCCURING PROBLEM WITH TOO MANY TO COUNT FAILURES. PROBLEM IS TEMPORARILY ALLEVIATED BY MANUALLY FEEDING THE BELT INTO THE RETRACTOR.*AK

STARTING IN JAN 2004, MY DRIVERS SIDE SEATBELT DISENGAGED ON ITS OWN WHILE DRIVING. IN THE LAST TWO MONTHS IT HAS DONE THIS SEVERAL TIMES, ALWAYS WITHOUT WARNING. SOME TIMES THE BELT WILL STAY LATCHED FOR THE WHOLE TRIP, SOME TIMES IT WILL RELEASE BEFORE I CAN REACH THE END OF THE DRIVEWAY, MORE OFTEN IT WILL RELEASE WHILE I'M DRIVING ON THE HIGHWAY. I HAVE NOT YET HAD A CHANCE TO SPEAK WITH A DEALER ABOUT THE PROBLEM. *AK
WITHOUT WARNING VEHICLE STARTED ROLLING BACKWARDS ON A SLIGHT DECLINING RAMP.  CONSUMER WAS UNABLE TO STOP THE VEHICLE FROM ROLLING INTO A TREE. CONSUMER STATED THAT THE EMERGENCY BRAKE FAILED.*AK

LTR FM NILA ANN HAMILTON (CA) OWNER OF A 1994 JEEP WRANGLER SEEKING TO BE REIMBURSED. THE DRIVER SIDE SEAT BELT OF THE 1994 JEEP WRANGLER UNLATCHED UNEXPECTEDLY.  NON-ACCIDENT RELATED.  FIRST CONTACTED DAIMLER CHRYSLER 9/24/2003, FILE NUMBER IS 11683745.  *LA

REPLACEMENT OF THE FUEL TANK SENDING UNIT GASKET IN THE 1994 JEEP WRANGLER.   *MR   ALTHOUGH THERE WAS A RECALL (#94V106000), FOR THE REPLACEMENT OF THE FUEL TANK SENDING UNIT GASKET, BOTH THE JEEP DEALER AND THE CHRYSLER CUSTOMER SERVICE CENTER STATED THAT THERE WERE NONE.  THE CONSUMER HAD GONE AND PAID FOR THE REPAIR.  THE CONSUMER HAD NOTICED A STRONG GAS ODOR WHENEVER THE GAS TANK WAS FILLED.  THE MECHANIC STATED THAT THE VEHICLE NEEDED A FUEL TANK SENDING UNIT GASKET.  THE CONSUMER ALSO REQUESTED REIMBURSEMENT.   *SCC   *JB

THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED AND OFF WHEN IT ROLLED DOWN THE CONSUMERS DRIVEWAY AND HIT A WALL.  THE VEHICLES REAR PASSENGER SIDE TIRE BLEW OUT AND THE REAR BUMPER BENT ON IMPACT.  WHEN THE CONSUMER ENTERED THE VEHICLE SHE NOTICED THAT THE PARKING BRAKE HAD RELEASED ITSELF.  IT WAS LATER DETERMINED THAT THIS PROBLEM WAS RECALL AND THE CONSUMER REQUESTED REIMBURSEMENT (RECALL # 02V- 041000).   *MR   *SCC  *NLM
SEAT BELT BUCKLE WILL NOT LATCH.  DEALER WANTED ME TO PAY FOR REPAIR, $130.  *JB
WHILE THE AIRBAG LIGHT ILLUMINATED.  *NLM
THE VEHICLE ROLLED AND HIT THE SIDE OF THE CONSUMER'S DRIVEWAY.  THE CONSUMER NOTICED THE EMERGENCY BRAKE RELEASED ITSELF.  *MR  SCC  *JB
VEHICLE ROLLED BACK WHILE IN PARK AND HIT A WALL. BLEW OUT THE RIGHT REAR TIRE AND BENT THE REAR BUMPER ON IMPACT WITH THE WALL. *DT
THE SKID PLATE WHICH WAS USED TO HOLD THE TRANSMISSION, HAD RUSTED OUT OF THE FRAME, WHICH CAUSED THE TRANSMISSION TO HAND DOWN.*JB
EMERGENCY BRAKE RECALL ON ALL 90-94 JEEP WRANGLERS, BECAUSE THEY CAN RELEASE WITHOUT WARNING.*JB
EMERGENCY BRAKE RELEASED ON ITS OWN, VEHICLE ROLLED OUT OF DRIVEWAY. IT HIT A WALL, THE RIGHT TIRE BLEW OUT,  WHICH PREVENTED VEHICLE FROM ROLLING INTO TRAFFIC.*AK  *JB
THE CATALYTIC CONVERTER NEEDED TO BE REPLACED.*JB

SEATBELT LATCH AND RETRACTOR  MY SEATBELT LATCH DOES NOT STAY FASTENED.  IT WILL RELEASE AT ANY TIME EVEN IF I AM NOT MOVING.  THE SEATBELT RETRACTOR WILL ALSO LOCK WHEN THE BELT IS FULLY RETRACTED AND CAN REMAIN THIS WAY FOR DAYS.  SOMETIMES I HAVE HAD TO DRIVE WITH NO SEATBELT!  THE RETRACTOR WILL ALSO LOCK WHEN THE BELT IS WITHDRAWN.  WHEN THIS HAPPENS THE BELT HAS TO BE MANUALLY FED INTO THE BELT RETRACTOR.  I HAVE BEEN TO THE DEALERSHIP WITH MY PROBLEM AND THEY JUST TELL ME THAT I WILL HAVE TO PURCHASE A NEW BELT.  THIS HAS BEEN A PROBLEM FOR ABOUT ONE YEAR.

WHILE IN PARK WITH PARKING BRAKE ENGAGED.  CONSUMER STATES THE VEHICLE SUDDENLY STARTED ROLLING BACKWARDS INTO THE STREET. PARKING BRAKE PEDAL WAS STILL ENGAGED.  CAUSE IS UNKWOWN.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.   PH
CONSUMER STATES THAT THE SEAT BELT WILL NOT EXTEND CAUSING THE DRIVER TO DRIVE WITHOUT A SEAT BELT. TS
THE ENTIRE U BOLT MECHANISM CAME APART FROM THE REAR GEAR BOX AND CAUSED EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO THE UNDERCARRIAGE OF THE CAR, AS WELL AS A VERY UNSAFE CONDITION.  DT
SAME ISSUE AS CAMPAIGN NUMBER 94V106000, ON SAME TYPE VEHICLE.  DT
CATALYTIC CONVERTER RATTLES LOUDLY.  NOISE IS INTERMITTENT, INDEPENDENT OF SPEED, ENGINE TEMP OR IF TRANSMISSION ENGAGED.  DT
CONSUMER STATES  OF HAVING PROBLEM WITH THE BRAKES. DELAR WAS CONTACTED. TS

VEHICLE HAS BEEN TAKEN TO DEALERSHIP DUE PROBLEM WITH GASKET.  THIS VEHICLE IS OUTSIDE OF THE REMEDY SCOPE AND IS NOT INCLUDED IN NHTSA RECALL CAMPAIGN 94V106000 FUEL PUMP.  PLEASE DESCRIBE DETAILS.   MR

GEARS DISENGAGE ON THEIR OWN, AND AFTER ABOUT 5 SECONDS POPS OUT OF GEAR.  CAUSE IS UNKNOWN.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.*AK

WHEN STARTING VEHICLE, THERE WAS A GASOLINE ODOR.  THE CONSUMER HAD TAKEN THE  VEHICLE TO THE DEALER WHO STATED THAT THE GASKET ON TOP OF THE FUEL TANK WAS LEAKING.   THE FUEL LEAK COULD CAUSE A FIRE.  *AK  *SCC

VEHICLE WAS PARKED IN FRONT OF THE HOUSE AND WITHOUT PRIOR WARNING VEHICLE TOOK OFF ON ITS ON . DEALERSHIP WAS AWARE OF PROBLEM.*AK  THE EMERGENCY BRAKE FAILED TO STOP THE VEHICLE AT THE TIME THE VEHICLE TOOK OFF. *YH
PARKING EMERGENCY BRAKE RELEASED WITHOUT PRIOR WARNING.   VEHICLE WAS PARKED, AND ROLLED INTO THE STREET.  DEALERSHIP WAS AWARE OF  PROBLEM.  *AK
EMERGENCY BRAKE CAME UNDONE, CAUSING VEHICLE TO ROLL BACKWARD.*AKI
WHILE DRIVING IT LEAKS FUEL. TOOK VEHICLE TO DEALER, PROBLEM WAS NOT REMEDIED, HOWEVER, THERE IS A RECALL 94V106000 ON THE THIS ISSUE. *AK  *YH
UPON STARTING VEHICLE AND LEAVING IT IN THE PARK POSITION IT AUTOMATICALLY RELEASES INTO REVERSE AND ROLLS. CONSUMER HAS HAD TO RUN AND STOP VEHICLE. CONTACTED THE DEALER. *AK  *YH

PARKING BRAKE RELEASES WITHOUT WARNING.  IF SETTING BRAKE AND WALKING AWAY, BRAKE WILL POP OFF AND ROLL IF NOT IN GEAR.  VEHICLE IS MANUAL TRANSMISSION.  CHRYSLER SAYS THERE IS NO RECALL ON MY VEHICLE FOR THIS PROBLEM.*AK

DRIVER HAD TO MAKE A SUDDEN STOP WHEN  PASSENGER'S FRONT SEATBELT EXTENDED FULLY.  BELT WOULD  NOT RETRACT.  DRIVER IS CONCERNED BELT MAY NOT HOLD IN AN ACCIDENT.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.*AK

SPOKE W/ CHRYSLER AND THE DEALERSHIP DIRECTLY ABOUT LEAK IN DASHBOARD. SINCE MY VEHICLE WAS OUT OF WARRANTY, NEITHER WOULD DO ANYTHING ABOUT PROBLEM W/O HAVING THEIR MECHANIC INSPECT THE VEHICLE AT A COST OF $75/HR. PAYABLE BY OWNER (ME). I POINTED OUT ALL THEY NEEDED TO DO WAS LOOK AT THE PASSENGER SIDE FLOORBOARD TO SEE THE PUDDLE OF WATER LEFT AFTER IT RAINED THE NIGHT BEFORE. AFTER MY EXPERIENCE W/ CHRYSLER REGARDING THE CRACKED GASKET ON MY FUEL TANK, WHICH I JUST FOUND OUT WAS A RECALL ISSUE, I FIGURED THERE WAS NOTHING I COULD DO AND HAVE ENDURED THE INCONVENIENCE EVER SINCE. I HAVE MET ANOTHER PERSON W/ A NEWER MODEL WRANGLER W/ SAME PROBLEM OF LEAKAGE VIA DASHBOARD. I HOPE THERE ARE OTHERS OUT THERE W/ SAME PROBLEM IN THE HOPES THAT CHRYSLER WILL RECOGNIZE THE SITUATION AND FIX IT. *AK

I WAS PULLING OUT OF A PARKING LOT ONTO A MAIN ROAD, I WAS IN 1ST GEAR (MANUAL SHIFT) SHIFTING INTO SECOND GEAR WHEN ALL OF A SUDDEN A A BEARING OR PUSHROD SHOT THRU THE OIL PAN, WITH NO WARNING.  THERE WAS NOTHING SEEMINGLY WRONG WITH THE VEHICLE, IT IS OUT OF WARRANTY BY YEARS, BUT HAS VERY LOW MILES.  IT WAS MATICULOUSLY MAINTAINED.  OIL WAS CHANGED IN THE VEHICLE EVERY 3000 MILES.  THE ONLY PROBLEM WE HAD WITH THE VEHICLE SINCE WE BOUGHT IT, WAS A REAR MAIN SEAL LEAK.  IT WAS FIXED UNDER WARRANTY AT THE DEALERSHIP TWICE FOR THAT.
WHILE DRIVING IN AT 70 MPH I LOST 5TH GEAR.  *AK

THE VEHICLE WAS PARKED IN A PARKING LOT ON A MODERATELY FLAT SURFACE. THE APRKING BRAKE HAD BEEN ENGAGED.  I WAS ALERTED BY LOCAL SECURITY THAT MY VEHICLE HAD ROLLED OUT OF IT'S PARKING SPOT.  IT ROLLED APPROXIMATELY 20 YARDS INTO THE REAR END OF ANOTHER PARKED CAR.  THIS PARKING BRAKE HAD BEEN "FIXED" ONE TIME BEFORE.  THE PARKING BRAKE DOES NOT HOLD ON ANYTHING MORE THAN A FLAT SURFACE. IT'S BEEN FIXED REPEATEDLY, BUT WITHIN DAYS OF BEING FIXED IT WILL "POP" AND BE TOO LOOSE TO HOLD  THE VEHICLE.*AK
VEHICLE SLIPS OUT OF PARK AND  TAKES  OFF WHEN ENGINE IS ON! *AK

WHILE TRAVELING DOWN A MAJOR HIGHWAY, 695 IN BALTIMORE, BOTH EXTERIOR HOOD LATCHES BECAME UNHINGED.  MOMENTS LATER, THE LATCH LOCATED AT THE INTERIOR CENTER FRONT OF THE HOOD FAILED ALSO.  THIS CAUSED THE HOOD TO FLY UPWARD TOWARDS THE WINDSHIELD, STRIKING THE GLASS AND CAUSING IT TO SHATTER.  I WAS FORCED TO PULL BLINDLY TO THE SHOULDER OF THE ROAD, BECAUSE THE HOOD HAD FOLDED ITSELF OVER THE FRAME OF THE WINDSHIELD AND WAS STILL LODGED IN PLACE.  AFTER RETURNING THE HOOD TO ITS ORIGINAL POSITION, I OBSERVED SUBSTANSIAL BODY DAMAGE TO THE HOOD AND WINDSHIELD.*AK

THERE IS A FUEL ODOR IN  PASSENGER COMPARTMENT.  DEALERSHIP  INFORMED  CONSUMER VEHICLE IS NOT INCLUDED IN RECALL 94V106000.   DEALERSHIP HAS YET TO EXAMINE THE VEHICLE.  PLEASE PROVIDE ANY ADDITIONAL INFORMATION/ATTACHMENTS.*AK

THE EXHAUST MANIFOLD IS A WELDED TUBULAR HEADER.  AT APPROXIMATELY 50,000 MILES THE WELD AT THE COLLECTOR CRACKS.  I DON'T KNOW IF I AM AT RISK OF CARBON MONOXIDE POISONING BECAUSE OF THIS FAILURE.  THIS HAS HAPPENED TWICE NOW AND IT IS APPROXIMATELY A 600.00 REPAIR.  IN TALKING TO THE REPAIR DEPT. AT A LOCAL DEALERSHIP, THIS IS A FAIRLY COMMON PROBLEM.  THE SAME PROBLEM HAS OCCURRED TWICE TO MY FATHER'S 1997 JEEP WRANGLER ALSO.*AK
VEHICLE NOT INCLUDED RECALL NUMBER 94V106000.   FUEL TANK SENDING UNIT GASKET HAS CRACKED, CAUSING FUEL AND FUEL VAPOR LEAKAGE. PLEASE GIVE ANY FURTHER DETAILS. *AK
FRONT BRAKE ROTORS SEPARATED FROM DISC. *AK

I HAVE PUT 2 STARTERS ON THIS JEEP IN THE 2 YEARS THAT I'VE OWNED IT AND THE LADY THAT OWNED IT BEFORE ME SAID SHE PUT 2 OR 3 ON IT. PLEASE CHECK INTO THIS FOR ME AND LET ME KNOW IF IT'S JUST MY JEEP. I FOUND A TECHNICAL SERVICE BULLETIN ABOUT STARTERS BUT I'M NOT SURE IF IT'S THE RIGHT THING OR NOT. THANKS.*AK
PARKING BRAKE HAS NEVER HELD VEHICLE WHEN IN NEUTRAL, ON 3 OCCASSIONS THE BRAKE HAS RELEASED AFTER LEAVING THE VEHICLE.         *JB
VEHICLE IS LEAKING FUEL. HOWEVER,MANUFACTURER INFORMED  CONSUMER THAT IT WAS NOT  PART OF  RECALL 94V106000 DUE TO VIN.   *AK   *SLC
WHEN  STARTING CAR IT RATTLES VERY BADLY, AND  CONSUMER CAN SMELL EXHAUST FUMES.  TOOK TO MECHANIC,  AND THEY SAID IT WAS CATALYTIC CONVERTER.-*AK
NO SUMMARY LISTED FOR ABOVE VEHICLE.  *AK

AFTER DETECTING A SIGNIFICANT FUEL LEAK ON MY VEHICLE, I CONSULTED NHTSA'S WEBSITE.  AS THIS WAS AN UNEXPECTED/UNUSUAL OCCURRENCE, I SUSPECTED A RECALL MAY BE IN EFFECT.  I CONFIRMED CAMPAIGN #94V106000 IS IN EFFECT FOR ~230,000 UNITS, AND THAT THE PROBLEM I WAS EXPERIENCING WAS CONSISTENT WITH THE RECALL.  I CONTACTED CHRYSLER NATIONAL SERVICE ~17 NOV AND RECEIVED ADVICE TO PRESENT IT TO DEALER FOR REPAIR AND INCLUSION UNDER RECALL.  FOLLOWING SCHEDULED APPOINMENT AND REPAIRS FOR A SAFETY ITEM, FOLLOW-UP WITH CHRYSLER FOR REIMBURSEMENT HAS BEEN UNSUCCESSFUL.  CHRYSLER MAINTAINS THAT MY VEHICLE IS NOT AFFECTED, DESPITE CONSISTENCY WITH OTHER SIMILARLY AFFECTED VEHICLES.  REQUEST REIMBURSEMENT FOR $162.60 FOR THIS SAFETY ITEM -- FUEL LEAK NEAR IGNITION SOURCE (EXHAUST SYSTEM) WAS NOT AN OPTIONAL REPAIR, AND CHRYSLER SHOULD HONOR INCLUSION FOR THIS FAIRLY NEGLIGIBLE AMOUNT. *AK
PARKING BRAKE FAILS TO HOLD, ALLOWING THE VEHICLE TO ROLL AWAY.  *AK
FRONT DRIVER'S SIDE SEAT BELT DOES NOT RETRACT ON OCCASIONS. ALSO, IT DOES NOT LATCH PROPERLY.DEALER HAS BEEN CONTACTED.*AK

I HAVE 3 TIRES ON RECALL LIST THE 4TH HAS A W2 DOT BUT IT SHOWS SIGNS OF CRACKING WORSE THEN THOSE ON THE RECALL  FIRESTONE SAYS TO JUST WAIT TO SEE IF THEY ARE INCLUDED BUT THIS IS A VERY UNSAFE TIRE AND SO I HAVE IT SITTING IN THE BACKYARD - WHAT ARE YOU DOING ON EXPANDING TO ALL WILDERNESS THEY HAVE STARTED RECALLING THE 16" TIRES FROM DOT W2 BUT WHY NOT THE 15" (DOT NUMBER: W2HL  TIRESIZE: P235/75R15)

I FEEL WRANGLER ARE ADVERTISED AS RUGGED - BUT THEY ARE ANYTHING BUT RUGGED!! LOTS OF TROUBLE.  CHRYSLER DID NOTHING TO HELP EXCEPT OFFER COSTLY REPAIRS (NEW SEAT FOR $1,200 THAT WAS CHEAPLY MADE, FIX DOOR LOCKS FOR $200 THAT KEPT BREAKING AND WINDOWS THAT WOULD NOT ROLL UP OR DOWN EASILY) THAT I FELT SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN AT MY EXPENSE.  CHRYSLER'S ANSWERS WHEN I COMPLAINED WERE - I USED EXCESSIVE FORCE ALL THE TIME.  THE DRIVERS SEAT BROKE - FIRST TIME I RECLINDED IT.  AFTER TEARING IT APART - IT WAS OBVIOUSLY MADE VERY CHEAPLY - ONE THIN METAL PART GOING UP THE BACK OF THE SEAT.  HOW IS THAT GOING TO HOLD ANYONE IN CASE OF REAR IMPACT OR RECLINING THE SEAT WITHOUT BREAKING??  SAME WITH THE PLASTIC PARTS FOR THE WINDOW ROLLER (EASILY BREAKABLE) AND WHO DESIGNED THE STUPID PART (BAR AND PIN) FOR THE DOOR LOCKS.  OH YEAH, AND MY ENGINED DIED ONCE - $200 IN NEW WIRING AND TOE BILLS.  THEY TOLD ME I MUST HAVE BEEN OFFROAD RUFFING IT - EXCESSIVE FORCE AGAIN.  I NEVER TOOK THE JEEP OFFROAD EVER - BUT OF COURSE THEY WOULD NOT BELIEVE ME.  ALSO, I HAVE REPLACED THE FRONT WINDSHIELD 3 TIMES NOW.  MY MAIN POINT IS CHRYSLER FAILED ME - SOLD ME A VERY CHEAPLY MADE VEHICLE AND DID NOT STAND BEHIND THEIR CHEAP PRODUCT.  I FELL I AM THE BEST OR WORSE ADVERTISER FOR THIS VEHICLE THEY HAVE AND I MAKE SURE TO FULLY EXPLAIN ALL THE PROBLEMS I HAVE EXPERIENCED WITH MY WRANGLER.

components: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE
summary: SENDING UNIT IS NOT INSTALLED CORRECTLY/GASKET IS CRACKED.  CONSUMER  IS HAVING THE SAME PROBLEM AS MENTIONED IN RECALL  94V106000, CONSUMER FEELS IF REAR ENDED JEEP MAY BLOW UP BECAUSE OF  FUEL LEAKING ALL OVER THE PLACE.*AK
SEAT BELTS OFTEN GET CAUGHT IN LATCH OF DOOR- BOTH SIDES OF VEHICLE.  EACH TIME THIS HAPPENS THE WEBBING DEGRADES. *AK

EXHAUST MANIFOLD - REAR STUD ON DRIVER'S SIDE HAS BROKEN OFF LEADING TO AN EXHAUST LEAK.  CAUSES NOISE AND EXCESS O2 IN EXHAUST SYSTEM SIGNAL COMPUTER TO INCREASE FUEL RICHNESS WHICH TAXES THE CATALYTIC CONVERTER, CAUSING EARLY FAILURE.  CATALYTIC CONVETER HAS BEEN REPLACED THREE TIMES AS RESULT.  DOOR LOCKS - THE DOOR LOCKS ON BOTH THE PASSENGER AND DRIVER SIDE HAVE BROKEN, MAKING IT IMPOSSIBLE TO UNLOCK DOOR FROM OUTSIDE WITH KEY.  BY TURNING KEY, THE LOCK BEGINS TO DISENGAGE, BUT NOT ENOUGH TO UNLOCK DOOR.  THIS CREATES NEED TO LEAVE WINDOWS DOWN CONTINUOUSLY IN ORDER TO GAIN ACCESS TO VEHICLE BY OPENING DOOR FROM INSIDE THROUGH WINDOW.  MAJOR SECURITY ISSUE!

EXHAUST MANIFOLD - REAR STUD ON DRIVER'S SIDE HAS BROKEN OFF LEADING TO AN EXHAUST LEAK.  CAUSES NOISE AND EXCESS O2 IN EXHAUST SYSTEM SIGNAL COMPUTER TO INCREASE FUEL RICHNESS WHICH TAXES THE CATALYTIC CONVERTER, CAUSING EARLY FAILURE.  CATALYTIC CONVETER HAS BEEN REPLACED THREE TIMES AS RESULT.  DOOR LOCKS - THE DOOR LOCKS ON BOTH THE PASSENGER AND DRIVER SIDE HAVE BROKEN, MAKING IT IMPOSSIBLE TO UNLOCK DOOR FROM OUTSIDE WITH KEY.  BY TURNING KEY, THE LOCK BEGINS TO DISENGAGE, BUT NOT ENOUGH TO UNLOCK DOOR.  THIS CREATES NEED TO LEAVE WINDOWS DOWN CONTINUOUSLY IN ORDER TO GAIN ACCESS TO VEHICLE BY OPENING DOOR FROM INSIDE THROUGH WINDOW.  MAJOR SECURITY ISSUE! *AK

ACCORDING TO THIS SITE, THE 1994 JEEP WRANGLER HAD A RECALL OF THE CATALYTIC CONVERTER.  BEGINNING 31JAN96, I TOOK MY JEEP TO SHELBY MOTORS APROX 7 TIMES BECAUSE OF "RATTLING NOISE" WITH THE SAME RESPONSE FROM THEM "WE DON'T KNOW WHAT IT IS.  NOW THERE IS NO LONGER A WARRANTY ON MY VEHICLE, SHELBY MOTORS DECLARES THE VEHICLE NEEDS A NEW CATALYTIC CONVERTER ABSOLVING THEMSELVES OF ANY RESPONSIBILITY.  I APPEALED TO THEIR SENSE OF PROFESSIONALISM AND LOYALTY TO THEIR CUSTOMERS, BUT FOUND THEIR INTEREST DOESN'T LIE IN THE CUSTOMER'S LOYALTY TO THEM BUT RATHER IN THEIR MONEY.  I HAVE NEVER BEEN NOTIFIED BY CHRYSLER CORPORATION OR SHELBY MOTORS OF ANY RECALL.  ANY ASSISTANCE YOU CAN PROVIDE WOULD BE GREATLY APPRECIATED GIVEN I'VE BEEN STRUGGLING WITH THIS FOR 4 YEARS.
THE FRONT DOORS DO NOT UNLOCK WITH THE KEY/ IT SLIPPED OUT OF PARK.
THE DEALER TOLD MY VEHICLE WASN'T COVERED BECAUSE OF THE MANUFACTURED DATE.  HOWEVER I'M HAVING THE EXACT PROBLEM AS DESCRIBED IN THE RECALL. NO SAFETY DEFECT MENTIONED IN SUMMARY. *AK
THE CHANNEL THAT RIVETS THE CANVAS TOP DOWN OVER VEHICLE, IS SEPARATING. IT FAILS TO KEEP TOP OVER VEHICLE WHILE DRIVING. HAS TO STOP & READJUST TOP. COULD CAUSE TRAFFIC HAZARD.  *AK

WHILE DRIVING TO WORK STARTED HEARING A RATTLING NOISE SO  CONSUMER STOPPED. TOOK OFF THE SOFT TOP AND NOTICED THAT PIN THAT HOLDS THE TOP FRAME TOGETHER BROKE AT LEASED 80% . IF PLASTIC PART HAD BROKEN THE WHOLE TOP COULD HAVE FLIPPED UP.
WHILE DRIVING ON THE EXPRESSWAY ABOUT 55 MPH, CONSUMER EXPERIENCED A FUEL LEAK THAT COULD HAVE CAUSED A FIRE WHICH COULD HAVE RESULTED IN PROPERTY DAMAGE.  *AK
FUEL TANK WARPED, PUSHED UP FUEL PUMP AND SENSOR, SMASHED BOTH COMPONENTS AND LEAKED GAS ALL OVER THE GAS TANK AND BACK END OF MY JEEP.   HAD TO REPLACE THE ENTIRE FUEL UNIT.

THE FRONT SEAT BELTS RETRACTORS DO NOT RELEASE LIKE IT SHOULD. CANNOT RETRACT BACK TO ORIGINAL POSITION, HANG LOOSE. PASSENGER'S SIDE PARTIALLY RETRACTS OUT, BUT NOT BACK IN. TOOK TO DEALER & MECHANIC UNABLE TO REPAIR & REFERRED TO DIFFERENT DEALER  FOR REPAIRS.  *AK

I HAVE A 1994 JEEP CHEROKEE GRAND LAREDO AND IT CAME WITH A 16"  "DOUGHNUT" SPARE TIRE.  A FEW DAYS AGO I HAD TO CHANGE A FLAT TIRE, AND WHEN I TRIED TO DRIVE ON THE SMALL SPARE TIRE, THE CAR WOULD START TO VIBRATE VIOLENTLY EVERY FEW BLOCKS.  I WOULD MAKE A COMPLETE STOP, AND I COULD START DRIVING FOR ABOUT TWO BLOCKS, BEFORE THE CAR STARTED THE SAME PROBLEM.  I WAS TOLD THAT THE SPARE WAS TOO SMALL AND THAT THE FOUR WHEEL DRIVE WAS TRYING TO ENGAGE EVEN THOUGH IT WAS ALREADY RUNNING IN FOUR WHEEL DRIVE.  HE TOLD ME THAT I HAD A 4 WHEEL HIGH AND LOW TRANSMISSION, AND THIS IS WHY I COULDN'T USE THIS SPARE THAT WAS SUPPLIED WITH THE AUTOMOBILE.  HE ALSO TOLD ME THAT THE 1996 JEEP CHEROKEE GRAND LAREDO WAS RECALLED FOR THIS PROBLEM, BUT NOT THE 1994.

DURING ROUTINE ANNUAL SAFETY INSPECTION, BOTH FRONT ROTORS WERE FOUND TO BE WEARING UNEVENLY.  THE OUTSIDE EDGE WAS THINNING TO THE POINT OF FAILURE.  THE MECHANIC AT THE SHOP TOLD ME THAT HE HAD SEEN THIS PROBLEM WITH WRANGLERS NUMEROUS TIMES.  THE ROTORS WERE WORN TO THE POINT THAT THEY COULD NOT BE MACHINED AND WOULD NEED REPLACEMENT AT THE TIME OF NEXT STATE INSPECTION 9/9/99. REPAIRS WERE QUOTED AT 300.00 FOR REPLACEMENT AND LABOR OF THE TWO ROTORS.  *MJS
